identificationModule.briefTitle: Short-term Effect of PCSK9 Inhibitor in Patients With Acute Ischemic Stroke
identificationModule.officialTitle: Short-term Effect of Proprotein Convertase Subtilisin/Kexin Type 9 Inhibitor in Chinese Population With Acute Ischemic Stroke: the Singe-center Real-world Study

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This is a prospective cohort study to investigate the early impact of evolocumab on patients with acute ischemic stroke (AIS) in China. Evolocumab, a proprotein convertase subtilisin/kexin taye 9 inhibitor, can significantly reduce low density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-C) levels and has a positive effect on improving cardiovascular events. However, existing studies have focused almost exclusively on the long-term effects of Evolocumab, and the early effects of Evolocumab on AIS patients remains unclear.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: Patients aged 18-80 years old admitted to the Department of Neurology, Xuanwu Hospital, Capital Medical University, with a definite diagnosis of acute ischemic stroke and receiving lipid-lowering therapy with statins with or without evolocumab will be included in this study. Participants will be divided into two groups according to the lipid-lowering therapy they used: 1) statin-alone group: the participants receive statins alone (atorvastatin 20mg qn or rosuvastatin 10mg qn or pivastatin 2mg qn) for lipid reduction, and 2) PCSK9-i group: the participants receive statins (atorvastatin 20mg qn or rosuvastatin 10mg qn or pivastatin 2mg qn) and evolocumab (140mg twice a month) for lipid reduction. Most importantly, the lipid-lowering therapy of participants will be decided only by clinicians not involved in the study, not by the investigators. The levels of blood lipid (TC, TG, HDL-C, LDL-C, Apo AI and Apo B) and inflammatory biomarkers (hsCRP and IL-6) of these participants at different time points (day 1, day 3, day 5, and month 3) will be recorded. The target level of LDL-C is the LDL-C reduction ≥50% from the baseline and LDL-C\<1.4mmol/L (55mg/dL). In addition, the cardiovascular events and adverse drug reactions of these participants during follow-up will also be recorded. During the follow-up period (3 months), participants who changed their lipid-lowering regimen, including the type, dosage and frequency of statins and evolocumab, will be excluded from the study.

armGroups.label: Statin-alone group
armGroups.description: The participants in statin-alone group receive statins alone for lipid reduction.

armGroups.label: PCSK9-i group
armGroups.description: The participants in PCSK9-i group receive statins and evolocumab for lipid reduction.

interventions.name: Statins
interventions.description: Atorvastatin 20mg qn or rosuvastatin 10mg qn or pivastatin 2mg qn, oral

interventions.name: Evolocumab
interventions.description: Evolocumab 140mg twice a month, subcutaneous injection

primaryOutcomes.measure: LDL-C target achievement rate on Day 5, Month 3
primaryOutcomes.description: LDL-C target achievement rate= Number of patients who achieved the LDL-C target level/ Total number of follow-up patients

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Percentage change in LDL-C level on Day 1, Day 3, Day 5, and Month 3
secondaryOutcomes.description: Percentage change in LDL-C level= (follow-up LDL-C level - baseline LDL-C level)/ baseline LDL-C level

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Percentage change in HDL-C level on Day 1, Day 3, Day 5, and Month 3
secondaryOutcomes.description: Percentage change in HDL-C level= (follow-up HDL-C level - baseline HDL-C level)/ baseline HDL-C level

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Percentage change in TC level on Day 1, Day 3, Day 5, and Month 3
secondaryOutcomes.description: Percentage change in TC level= (follow-up TC level - baseline TC level)/ baseline TC level

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Percentage change in TG level on Day 1, Day 3, Day 5, and Month 3
secondaryOutcomes.description: Percentage change in TG level= (follow-up TG level - baseline TG level)/ baseline TG level

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Percentage change in Apo AI level on Day 1, Day 3, Day 5, and Month 3
secondaryOutcomes.description: Percentage change in Apo AI level= (follow-up Apo AI level - baseline Apo AI level)/ baseline Apo AI level

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Percentage change in Apo B level on Day 1, Day 3, Day 5, and Month 3
secondaryOutcomes.description: Percentage change in Apo B level= (follow-up Apo B level - baseline Apo B level)/ baseline Apo B level

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Percentage change in hsCRP level on Day 1, Day 3, Day 5, and Month 3
secondaryOutcomes.description: Percentage change in hsCRP level= (follow-up hsCRP level - baseline hsCRP level)/ baseline hsCRP level

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Percentage change in IL-6 level on Day 1, Day 3, Day 5, and Month 3
secondaryOutcomes.description: Percentage change in IL-6 level= (follow-up IL-6 level - baseline IL-6 level)/ baseline IL-6 level

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Percentage of mRS≤2 on Month 3
secondaryOutcomes.description: Percentage of mRS≤2= Number of patients with mRS≤2/ Total number of follow-up patients

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Incidence of major cardiovascular events on Month 3
secondaryOutcomes.description: Major cardiovascular events: stroke, cardiovascular death, myocardial infarction, hospitalization for unstable angina, and coronary revascularization.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Incidence of adverse events on Month 3
secondaryOutcomes.description: Adverse events: injection site reaction, anaphylaxis, myopathy, abnormal liver function, new onset diabetes, cognitive impairment, and hemorrhagic cerebral infarction.

eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Acute ischemic stroke patients aged 18 to 80 years
